lines.text: I'm asking you with my dying breath.
I've spent my entire life trying to stay out of the newspapers, and they've spent theirs getting into them.
I'll be getting out of here soon, and when I do I'll be an educated man. I've spent six years here in 'Stonewall College.' That's my alma mater.
You know, I doubt that I'll marry you after all. It would be cheaper to buy Bartlett's Familiar Quotations.
He can lick any woman his weight in the world.
Oh, you mean bootlegging. Well, of course, that never really was a business.
